result.execSummary:
The defendant Leslie T Olano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leslie T Olano is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Leslie T Olano was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, On or Near a Park], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay fine of $3000.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges; Drug Surcharge.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Perform 100 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Leslie T Olano, appeared with Attorney Mark D. Richards.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments are made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  See conditions.  Court imposes a fine of $3000 plus costs and Cash Bond on deposit is to be applied.  If any unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  As a condition she is ordered to complete 100 hrs. of community service work.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Parties appeared for Sentencing and due to congested court calendar sentencing has been rescheduled to 9/9/15 at 11:30 AM.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Leslie T Olano, appeared with Attorney Mark D. Richards.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 1 & 3 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 7/16/15 at 11:30 AM.

14CF1365/14CF1366
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Victor A Olano-Correa, appeared with Attorney Kevin D. Corrigall (14CF1366) and Defendant, Leslie T. Olano appears with Attorney Mark Richards (14CF1365).  
Atty Corrigall requests a change of plea date stating he wants to confirm the distance for the on or near park enhancer and State has no objection.  Plea Hearing on 6/3/15 at 11:30
to Unseal Affidavit in Support of Warrant filed by Atty Richards

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Leslie T Olano, appeared with Attorney Brian Dimmer specially for Attorney Mark D. Richards.  Clerk: PT
Atty Dimmer filed motion to dismiss before start of hearing.  Atty Binger states the affidavit which led to the search warrant was ordered sealed by Judge Milisauksas through law enforcement's request and he has no authority to unseal the affidavit.  Attorney Richards and Attorney Corrigall are seeking a court order to unseal the affidavit which resolves the motion to dismiss.  Atty Corrigall and Atty Richards will draft an order for courts approval.  FPT on 5/13/15 at 9:40 AM.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Leslie T Olano, appeared with Attorney Mark D. Richards.  Clerk: PT
Atty Binger states the search warrants are currently sealed and is still working with law enforcement to get them unsealed for defendant's attorney.  Status Conf. adj. to 3/31/15 at 11:00 AM.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Mark Richards. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Richards and co-def. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 2-24-15 @ 8:30am with co-def. Bond continued.
of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Richards and co-def. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman.

Defendant, Leslie T Olano, appeared with Attorney Mark D. Richards.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: with 14CF1366. Atty Richards & Corrigall requesting adjournment; DE waives time limits; no objection from the ST; so ordered. Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.

141pm  Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Aileen Henry.  Clerk: LE  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 11/25/14 @ 1045am.  $2500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  kmk
